Boynton House
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Maybeck, Bernard Ralph (American architect and artist, 1862-1957) [work]

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: View of courtyard from bottom of embankment

The Temple of Wings was originally designed and constructed as a Greco-Roman colonnaded open-air residence. The first drawings for the temple were done by Bernard Maybeck in 1911, and the project was completed by A. Randolph Monroe in 1914. http://berkeleyheritage.com/berkeley_landmarks/temple_of_wings.html [work]
